item.title: Setting up Octopus Deploy with a Service Principal - Azure CLI
item.description: I just was chatting to my mate Rob Pearson who was giving me some tips on setting up Azure with Octopus Deploy. In my case I was trying to set up a service account to do some deployments. I had already created a service account within my Active Directory with the relevant permissions. Rob pointed me to the Octopus Deploy docoumentation but I was struggling with the Azure Portal.

item.title: Let's Encrypt - Using the Azure CLI to create an Azure AD Application and Service Principal for an Azure Web Service
item.description: Recently I had to setup a static web site on Azure. At the time I was using an Azure Web App with a rudimentary GitHub deployment. Once setup, the next stage was to add SSL and I wanted to use Let’s Encrypt. I stumbled over to the Let’s Encrypt Site Extension mentioned in the gooroo blog. Most of my time these days is spent on OSX and Docker and I generally use a Docker Container to isolate accounts when using cloud services such as Azure and AWS.

item.title: Azure Auditing via PowerShell (Part 1)
item.description:
